alert.note: Alert for Northern Saratoga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued April 18 at 3:39AM EDT until April 19 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow expected for elevations greater than 1500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 8 inches. Much lesser amounts expected below 1500 feet of a couple inches or less. * WHERE...Northern Saratoga County. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 2 PM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute.The heavy wet snow may bring down some tree limbs and cause some power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow rates may approach an inch per hour early Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
